intro: Manihot gualanensis, commonly known as the Gualanensis arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically followed by capsule fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
